description: Ms. composite codex. Title from leaf 1b. Physical description: Text 1, 17 lines per page; written in naskh in black on glazed, laid European paper; rubrication and catchwords. Text 2, 15 lines per page; written in naskh in black on blue glazed, laid European paper; rubrication and catchwords. Mild staining; edges moldered. Origin: Text 1, 17 Rabīʻ II 1240 H [9 December 1824] in Iṣfahān, by Qurbān ʻAlī ibn Ḥājjī Muḥammad Rafīʻ al-... [?] (leaf 88b). Text 2, 4 Rabīʻ I 1240 H [27 October 1824], by Muḥammad Ḥasan (leaf 113b); likely in Iran.
contents: 2. fol. 89b-113b: Kitāb Zubdat Shaykh Bahāʼī fī al-uṣūl / Bahāʼ al-Dīn al-ʻĀmilī.
extent: 114 leaves : paper ; 211 x 150 (120-138 x 65-74) mm bound to 211 x 154 mm
title: Zubdat al-uṣūl wa-ghayrih
provenance: Owners' stamps on leaves 89b, 113b. Owner's note on leaf 1a.
subject: Manuscripts, Arabic—New Jersey—Princeton
binding_note: Limp black leather with blind-stamped fillets.
member_of_collections: Princeton Digital Library of Islamic Manuscripts
